header.title: Man City ace Bernardo Silva hit with FA ban over Benjamin Mendy tweet
header.subtitle: Manchester City forward Bernardo Silva has been banned for one match and fined £50,000 by the FA, after he sent a tweet comparing team-mate Benjamin Mendy to a Spanish confectionery brand cartoon.
header.postText: 'Manchester City winger Bernardo Silva faces a one-match ban, and a £50,000 fine, for a racially-insensitive social media post.', 'The Portuguese star tweeted a photo of team-mate Benjamin Mendy as a child, alongside an image of a Spanish confectionery brand cartoon.', 'He captioned the image with: Guess who?.', 'Silva later deleted the tweet, and insisted it was a joke with a friend.', 'Silva will now have to complete a face-to-face education programme, after admitting a breach of the FA rules, realted to race and/or colour and/or ethnic origin.', 'An FA statement read: Bernardo Silva has been suspended for one first team competitive fixture, fined £50,000 and must complete face - to - face education after admitting a breach of FA Rule E3.', 'The Manchester City midfielder’s social media activity on 22 September 2019 breached FA Rule E3(1), as it was insulting and/or improper and/or brought the game into disrepute, and constituted an Aggravated Breach, which is defined in FA Rule E3(2), as it included reference, whether expressed or implied, to race and/or colour and/or ethnic origin. ', 'Silva faced a potential six - game ban for the tweet, after the FA charged him at the start of last month. ', 'Portugal international Bernardo Silva wrote a letter to the FA, expressing his retreat over the social media post.', ' He apologised for his actions, as well as for any unintentional offence caused. ', ' Mandy added weight to Silva’ s case by sending his own letter to the FA, backing his team - mate. ', 'City manager Pep Guardiola has previously defended Silva for the tweet.', ' He claimed that Silva and Mendy are like brothers, and the post was supposed to be a joke.', 'But, Guardiola also admitted that he would understand if someone was offended by the tweet. ', 'If someone is offended, I can understand it, he said.Bernardo is maybe going to take a lesson and it won’ t happen again.', 'I know the intention of Bernardo.It was just a joke.Benjamin is like a brother to Bernardo.It is the same the other way.It is what I see every day in training. '
